page.title: 12Old Railway Path.
page.content: The Old Railway Path is thirteen miles long. It is now used for walking and cycling. The trains stopped in 1971 because the line was competing with another line and it lost business. The cyclepath runs from Bristol to Bath. Two of the places you can join the path are Saltford and Bitton Station. There is one official picnic site where the path crosses the River Avon near Bitton. However there are many other nice spots for picnics such as Saltford. The first section of the path was built in 1979 between Bitton and Bath by Cyclebag (a cycling group in Bristol) and the rest of the path has been built since about 1982. They are just finishing the last section into Bristol.
